page.title: 17Margam Mine
page.content: Early in 1985, West Glamorgan County Council gave the go ahead for a new Â£850,000 road improvement scheme for the planned Â£78 million drift mine. Annual production is estimated at 700,000 tons with 635 jobs created during construction and eventually 700 mining jobs. Drilling and seismic surveys for the proposed mine have been undertaken for a number of years on the local hills. In April 1985 the go ahead was given for an exploratory borehole on Moel Ton Mawr in connection with the mine. The borehole was to be dug to a depth of 1000 metres to establish the precise level of the seam where the Margam mine drifts were believed to intersect. Local councils still wait for a decision from the National Coal Board, amid speculation that it has been scrapped.
